context: Hybrid cloud storage dominance. NetApp reinvented itself as cloud services provider with partnerships with AWS (since 2012), Microsoft Azure (Azure NetApp Files), and Google Cloud. NetApp acquired Spot in 2020 for cloud workload optimization. Leadership claimed competitors were 'years behind' in cloud transformation. Kubernetes and container storage becoming important.

competitors.name: Dell EMC
competitors.notes: Leading competitor with broad storage portfolio including PowerMax, Unity XT, and software-defined storage

competitors.name: Pure Storage
competitors.notes: All-flash storage leader with Evergreen model and expanding cloud-native capabilities

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise
competitors.notes: Nimble Storage and 3PAR arrays with hybrid cloud focus

competitors.name: Hitachi Vantara
competitors.notes: Enterprise storage with Virtual Storage Platform (VSP) for mission-critical applications

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Hybrid cloud storage solutions and enterprise offerings

competitors.name: Amazon S3
competitors.notes: Dominant cloud object storage with 83.29% market share in enterprise data storage

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure Blob Storage
competitors.notes: Cloud storage with 9.14% market share, partner with NetApp on Azure NetApp Files

competitors.name: Nutanix
competitors.notes: Hyper-converged infrastructure and cloud software competitor
